comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Well they can't be accused of being too young in any event?  What my mother would call "It won't spoil their youth!"  Having said that they do look happy and comfortable in their own company which is always a good start for any marriage. This is a nice image, lovley and clear but the setting is that of a snapper rather than that of a photographer, if you know what I mean.  A downpipe to the right and a drain coming out of the kitchen behind, those are the kind of shots we've all taken and wished we had the moment back again to make the appropriate changes!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Still love it - downpipe, drain and all! :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 22584609@N02
comment._content:
this is typical environmental portrait. i love it. this down pipe is cool because it's real, it's there.
not really sure what sort of "photographer " swordscookie is talking about ;)
this is really good photograph in every detail!

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/artursikora] Yes, I was looking at that pic of yours earlier, and thought it might be. Keep an eye on it, and you'd get a better shot if prevailing wind direction changes! :)
